format_instructions.name: format_instructions
format_instructions.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

handle_parsing_errors.info: Should the Agent fix errors when reading user input for better processing?
handle_parsing_errors.name: handle_parsing_errors

input_value.info: The input provided by the user for the agent to process.
input_value.name: input_value

max_iterations.info: The maximum number of attempts the agent can make to complete its task before it stops.
max_iterations.name: max_iterations

n_messages.info: Number of chat history messages to retrieve.
n_messages.name: n_messages

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

mode.info: Choose variable syntax for your template.
mode.name: mode

template.name: template
template.value:
# Background

You are a helpful assistant that must use tools to answer questions and perform tasks regarding RTX Remix.

# Procedure

- You MUST ABSOLUTELY ALWAYS search through the documentation before responding to the user. Follow the instructions in the "Documentation Instructions" section for instruction on using the documentation.
- When the user asks how to do something, always assume they are asking about the RTX Remix Toolkit or Runtime Graphic User Interfaces unless specified otherwise (DO NOT mention the tools available to you).
- If the user requested you take an action or provide information about the current project, you may follow the instructions in the "RTX Remix Toolkit Instructions" section.

# Documentation Instructions

- DO NOT ATTEMPT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES TO PROVIDE AN ANSWER BASED ON YOUR TRAINING DATA.
- Use the {remix_documentation} tool to fetch the requested information from the RTX Remix documentation.
- Always provide the source you used to get to the answer provided to the user.
- If the user asks a question that can be ambiguous, request that they provide more information.
- If the user asks a question that cannot be answered using the documentation, simply say so and don't attempt to answer the question.

# RTX Remix Toolkit Instructions

- Use the tools provided by the "{remix_mcp_server}" MCP Server to interact with the RTX Remix Toolkit.
- Always verify if a recipe provided in the "MCP Server Recipes" sub-section matches the current user request. 
    - If a recipe matches, follow the instructions as closely as possible
    - If NO recipe matches the user request, try to use any combination of tools to complete the user's request

## MCP Server Recipes

{mcp_prompts}

node.description:
# RTX Remix Langflow Integration

This Langflow project provides an integration for the NVIDIA RTX Remix Toolkit through its REST API.

## Prerequisites

Before using this project, ensure you have completed the following steps:

1. **Install RTX Remix Toolkit**
   You must have the RTX Remix Toolkit installed on your system. Follow the installation guide here:
   [Installing the RTX Remix Toolkit](https://docs.omniverse.nvidia.com/kit/docs/rtx_remix/latest/docs/installation/install-toolkit.html)

2. **Run RTX Remix Toolkit**
   Make sure the RTX Remix Toolkit application is running before using this Langflow project.

3. **Create/Open a Project**
   You must have an RTX Remix project opened within the Toolkit. Learn how to set up a project here:
   [Setting Up a Project with the RTX Remix Toolkit](https://docs.omniverse.nvidia.com/kit/docs/rtx_remix/latest/docs/gettingstarted/learning-toolkitsetup.html)

### Quick Start Tutorial

To quickly get started with RTX Remix, follow the [Building Your First Mod for the RTX Remix Sample](https://docs.omniverse.nvidia.com/kit/docs/rtx_remix/latest/docs/tutorials/tutorial-remixtool.html) tutorial.

It goes through the process of installing the various required parts, setting them up and getting a project up and running.

## Getting Started

Once all prerequisites are met, the Langflow project should work without additional configuration.

### Testing the Connection

To verify everything is working correctly:

1. Open the Langflow project
2. Locate the **RTX Remix MCP Connection** node
3. Click the **refresh button** on the node
4. Verify that the various REST API tools appear

If the REST API tools appear after refreshing, your connection to RTX Remix Toolkit is working properly and you can begin using the available tools.

## Additional Resources

- [RTX Remix Documentation](https://docs.omniverse.nvidia.com/kit/docs/rtx_remix/latest/)
- [RTX Remix MCP Documentation](https://docs.omniverse.nvidia.com/kit/docs/rtx_remix/latest/docs/howto/learning-mcp.html)
- [RTX Remix REST API Documentation](https://docs.omniverse.nvidia.com/kit/docs/rtx_remix/latest/docs/howto/learning-restapi.html)
Connect to an MCP server to use its tools.

value.description:
Get the layer tree in the current stage.


**Query Parameters:**

- **layer_types**: The type of layer to get. Filtering by layer type will ignore layer children.

- **layer_count**: The number of layers to get per `layer_type`. If `layer_type` is not set this parameter will have no effect. Use -1 to get all the layers.


**Responses:**

- **200** (Success): Successful Response
  - Content-Type: `application/lightspeed.remix.service+json; version=1.0`

  - **Response Properties:**

    - **layers**: The list of layers in the layer stack

  - **Example:**

```json
  "layers": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error
  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**

exists.description: Filter an prim if it exists or not on a given layer. Use in conjunction with `layer_identifier` to filter on a given layer, otherwise this parameter will be ignored.
exists.title: Exists

filter_session_prims.description: Filter out the prims that exist on the session layer or not
filter_session_prims.title: Filter Session Prims

layer_identifier.description: Look for prims that exists or not on a given layer. Use the `exists` query parameter to set whether existing or non-existing prims should be returned.
layer_identifier.title: Layer Identifier

prim_hashes.description: Filter prim paths to keep specific hashes
prim_hashes.title: Prim Hashes

prim_types.description: Filter prim paths to keep specific types of prims
prim_types.title: Prim Types

selection.description: Select all prims (False) or the prims currently selected in the viewport (True)
selection.title: Selection

value.description:
Get the the prim paths in the current stage.


**Query Parameters:**

- **prim_hashes**: Filter prim paths to keep specific hashes

- **prim_types**: Filter prim paths to keep specific types of prims

- **selection**: Select all prims (False) or the prims currently selected in the viewport (True)

- **filter_session_prims**: Filter out the prims that exist on the session layer or not

- **layer_identifier**: Look for prims that exists or not on a given layer. Use the `exists` query parameter to set whether existing or non-existing prims should be returned.

- **exists**: Filter an prim if it exists or not on a given layer. Use in conjunction with `layer_identifier` to filter on a given layer, otherwise this parameter will be ignored.


**Responses:**

- **200** (Success): Successful Response
  - Content-Type: `application/lightspeed.remix.service+json; version=1.0`

  - **Response Properties:**

    - **prim_paths**: A list of prim paths

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "prim_paths": [
    "string"
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error
  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "detail": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```
value.display_description:
Get the the prim paths in the current stage.


**Query Parameters:**

- **prim_hashes**: Filter prim paths to keep specific hashes

- **prim_types**: Filter prim paths to keep specific types of prims

- **selection**: Select all prims (False) or the prims currently selected in the viewport (True)

- **filter_session_prims**: Filter out the prims that exist on the session layer or not

- **layer_identifier**: Look for prims that exists or not on a given layer. Use the `exists` query parameter to set whether existing or non-existing prims should be returned.

- **exists**: Filter an prim if it exists or not on a given layer. Use in conjunction with `layer_identifier` to filter on a given layer, otherwise this parameter will be ignored.


**Responses:**

- **200** (Success): Successful Response
  - Content-Type: `application/lightspeed.remix.service+json; version=1.0`

  - **Response Properties:**

    - **prim_paths**: A list of prim paths

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "prim_paths": [
    "string"
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error
  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "detail": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```

value.description:
Get a given material's textures. The prim must be a material.


**Path Parameters:**

- **prim_path** (Required): The prim path to the asset that will be inspected for textures


**Query Parameters:**

- **texture_types**: The type of textures to look for in the given material.


**Responses:**

- **200** (Success): Successful Response
  - Content-Type: `application/lightspeed.remix.service+json; version=1.0`

  - **Response Properties:**

    - **textures**: A list of prim paths (shader input paths) and their corresponding texture paths

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "textures": [
    [
      "example_item"
    ]
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error
  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "detail": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```

value.description:
Get a given prim's reference file paths.


**Path Parameters:**

- **prim_path** (Required): The prim path to the asset that will be inspected for file paths


**Responses:**

- **200** (Success): Successful Response
  - Content-Type: `application/lightspeed.remix.service+json; version=1.0`

  - **Response Properties:**

    - **reference_paths**: A list of prim paths and their corresponding reference relative paths and layer identifiers. Combine the reference path's relative path with the layer identifier to get the absolute reference path.

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "reference_paths": [
    [
      "example_item"
    ]
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error
  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "detail": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```

  - **Example:**

```json
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error

```json
  ]
```

  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "detail": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```

texture_types.description: The types of textures to look for
texture_types.title: Texture Types

value.description:
Get the texture properties and associated asset paths in the current stage.


**Query Parameters:**

- **prim_hashes**: Filter textures to keep textures from specific material hashes

- **texture_types**: The types of textures to look for

- **selection**: Select all prims (False) or the stage selection (True)

- **filter_session_prims**: Filter out prims that exist on the session layer or not

- **layer_identifier**: Look for textures that exist or not on a given layer. Use the `exists` query parameter to set whether existing or non-existing textures should be returned.

- **exists**: Filter an texture if it exists or not on a given layer. Use in conjunction with `layer_identifier` to filter on a given layer, otherwise this parameter will be ignored.


**Responses:**

- **200** (Success): Successful Response
  - Content-Type: `application/lightspeed.remix.service+json; version=1.0`

  - **Response Properties:**

    - **textures**: A list of prim paths (shader input paths) and their corresponding texture paths

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "textures": [
    [
      "example_item"
    ]
  ]
}
```

- **422**: Validation Error
  - Content-Type: `application/json`

  - **Response Properties:**

  - **Example:**
```json
{
  "detail": [
    "unknown_type"
  ]
}
```

- **layer_identifier**: Look for textures that exist or not on a given layer. Use the `exists` query parameter to set whether existing or non-existing textures should be returned.

use_cache.info: Enable caching of MCP Server and tools to improve performance. Disable to always fetch fresh tools and server updates.

verify_ssl.info: Enable SSL certificate verification for HTTPS connections. Disable only for development/testing with self-signed certificates.
